member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.AddSDMSResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds or replaces tags on a device or task.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device or task.
Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.AddSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.AddSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.AddSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceCmdlet
member.summary: Checks device-specific information, such as the device type, software version, IP addresses, and lock status.

para.para: The ID of the device that you are checking the information of.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeDeviceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeDeviceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ManagedDeviceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ManagedDeviceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceEc2InstanceCmdlet
member.summary: Checks the current state of the Amazon EC2 instances. The output is similar to describeDevice, but the results are sourced from the device cache in the Amazon Web Services Cloud and include a subset of the available fields.

para.para: A list of instance IDs associated with the managed device.
The ID of the managed device.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceEc2InstanceCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Instances'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeDeviceEc2InstancesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeDeviceEc2InstancesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceEc2InstanceCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ManagedDeviceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ManagedDeviceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceListCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of all devices on your Amazon Web Services account that have Amazon Web Services Snow Device Management enabled in the Amazon Web Services Region where the command is run.

para.para: The ID of the job used to order the device.
The maximum number of devices to list per page.
A pagination token to continue to the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Devices'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListDevicesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListDevicesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the JobId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^JobId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceResourceListCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of the Amazon Web Services resources available for a device. Currently, Amazon EC2 instances are the only supported resource type.

para.para: The ID of the managed device that you are listing the resources of.
A structure used to filter the results by type of resource.
The maximum number of resources per page.
A pagination token to continue to the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceResourceListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Resources'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListDeviceResourcesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListDeviceResourcesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSDeviceResourceListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ManagedDeviceId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ManagedDeviceId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSExecutionCmdlet
member.summary: Checks the status of a remote task running on one or more target devices.

para.para: The ID of the managed device.
The ID of the task that the action is describing.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSExecutionCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeExecutionResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeExecutionResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSExecutionListCmdlet
member.summary: Returns the status of tasks for one or more target devices.

para.para: A structure used to filter the tasks by their current state.
The ID of the task.
The maximum number of tasks to list per page.
A pagination token to continue to the next page of tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSExecutionListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Executions'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListExecutionsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListExecutionsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSExecutionListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the TaskId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^TaskId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of tags for a managed device or task.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device or task.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSTaskCmdlet
member.summary: Checks the metadata for a given task on a device.

para.para: The ID of the task to be described.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSTaskCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeTaskResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.DescribeTaskResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSTaskCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the TaskId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^TaskId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSTaskListCmdlet
member.summary: Returns a list of tasks that can be filtered by state.

para.para: A structure used to filter the list of tasks.
The maximum number of tasks per page.
A pagination token to continue to the next page of tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSTaskListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tasks'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListTasksResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.ListTasksResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.GetSDMSTaskListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the State parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^State' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.NewSDMSTaskCmdlet
member.summary: Instructs one or more devices to start a task, such as unlocking or rebooting.

para.para: A description of the task and its targets.
Reboots the device.
Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.
A list of managed device IDs.
Unlocks the device.
A token ensuring that the action is called only once with the specified details.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.NewSDMSTaskCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'TaskId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.CreateTaskResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.CreateTaskResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.NewSDMSTaskCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Description parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Description' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.NewSDMSTaskCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.RemoveSDMSResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Removes a tag from a device or task.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the device or task.
Optional metadata that you assign to a resource. You can use tags to categorize a resource in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, or environment.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.RemoveSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.RemoveSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.RemoveSDMSResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.StopSDMSTaskCmdlet
member.summary:
Sends a cancel request for a specified task. You can cancel a task only if it's still in a QUEUED state. Tasks that are already running can't be cancelled.
A task might still run if it's processed from the queue before the CancelTask operation changes the task's state.

para.para: The ID of the task that you are attempting to cancel. You can retrieve a task ID by using the ListTasks operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.StopSDMSTaskCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'TaskId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.CancelTaskResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SnowDeviceManagement.Model.CancelTaskResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.StopSDMSTaskCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the TaskId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^TaskId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SDMS.StopSDMSTaskCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
